title: King Tubby meets Jacob Miller: In a Tenement Yard (1976)
description:
Ã¢â‚¬Å“King Tubby Meets Jacob Miller: In a Tenement YardÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is one of the rarest dub albums ever to surface in Jamaica and, because of the specific ingredients of its creation, it's also one of the most unique.
 
Pressed in minute quantities in Jamaica, in or around 1976, it is virtually unknown, because it somehow surfaced in a blank sleeve, bearing only the label of a related 12-inch single: 'City of the Weak Heart', which was released on the obscure E-E Saw label. 

Produced by the Lewis Brothers (aka Fatman Riddim Section from Inner Circle) the album was composed of a number of Jacob Miller's most hard-hitting roots rhythms from the Tenement Yard and Killer albums. The album was mixed by the dub master himself, King Tubby, at Tubby's legendary Waterhouse facility.

The result is an exceptional and unique dub album.



King Tubby Meets Jacob Miller 

In a Tenement Yard

1976



  CD / 2006 / 320Kbps
